content.statement: dvt-005-iliofemoral-dvt is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Deep-Vein-Thrombosis that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding dvt-005-iliofemoral-dvt helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of dvt-005-iliofemoral-dvt include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of dvt-005-iliofemoral-dvt.

by_location.iliofemoral: Iliac veins AND common femoral vein
by_location.femoropopliteal: Femoral and/or popliteal veins - moderate risk

by_timing.acute: <14 days - best window for thrombus removal
by_timing.subacute: 14-28 days - may still benefit from intervention
by_timing.chronic: >28 days - organized thrombus, intervention less effective

imaging.duplex_ultrasound: First-line; may have limited iliac visualization
imaging.mr_venography: Alternative to CTV, no contrast option

early_thrombus_removal.indication: Young, low bleeding risk, symptoms <14 days, severe symptoms
early_thrombus_removal.goal: Reduce PTS severity, improve quality of life

iliac_stenting.indication: May-Thurner anatomy, residual iliac stenosis after thrombus removal
iliac_stenting.timing: After thrombus clearance, if underlying lesion present

definition.@value: DVT involving iliac and/or common femoral veins with higher PTS risk and potential benefit from early thrombus removal

clinical_pearls: Entire leg swelling = think iliofemoral level; calf only = more distal
50-60% of left-sided iliofemoral DVT have underlying May-Thurner anatomy
ATTRACT trial: CDT doesn't reduce overall PTS but may reduce SEVERE PTS
Best candidates for intervention: young, low bleed risk, symptoms <14 days, severe symptoms

medicalCode.description: Acute embolism and thrombosis of iliac vein

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
